This is an example article showcasing mathematical formulas, including inline formulas and standalone formula blocks.
Since Markdown uses escape characters like \, which can cause conflicts and lead to rendering errors in formulas, we replace \\(...\\) with $...$, \\[...\\] with $$...$$, and manually change the matrix line break symbol from \\ to \\\\.
Here are some configurations for MathJax.js:
MathJax = { tex: { inlineMath: [['$', '$'], ['\\(', '\\)']], displayMath: [['$$', '$$'], ['\\[', '\\]']] }, svg: { fontCache: 'global' }, options: { enableMenu: false } }; Inline Formulas Einstein’s mass-energy equation: $E = mc^2$, Pythagorean theorem: $a^2 + b^2 = c^2$
$E = mc^2$ $a^2 + b^2 = c^2$ Fractions and Integrals Standalone formula block example:
$$ \int_{-\infty}^\infty e^{-x^2} dx = \sqrt{\pi} $$
$$ \int_{-\infty}^\infty e^{-x^2} dx = \sqrt{\pi} $$ Fraction demonstration:
$$ \frac{\partial f}{\partial t} = \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x^2} $$
$$ \frac{\partial f}{\partial t} = \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x^2} $$ Matrices and Equation Systems Matrix representation:
$$ \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} $$
$$ \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\\\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} $$ Simultaneous equations:
$$ \begin{cases} 2x + y = 7 \\ 3x - 2y = 4 \end{cases} $$
$$ \begin{cases} 2x + y = 7 \\\\ 3x - 2y = 4 \end{cases} $$ Greek Letters and Symbols Common symbols: $\alpha, \beta, \gamma$, $\Rightarrow$, $\forall x \in \mathbb{R}$
$\alpha, \beta, \gamma$, $\Rightarrow$, $\forall x \in \mathbb{R}$ Binomial Theorem $$ (a + b)^n = \sum_{k=0}^n \binom{n}{k} a^{n-k}b^k $$
$$ (a + b)^n = \sum_{k=0}^n \binom{n}{k} a^{n-k}b^k $$ Chemical Equations $$ \ce{CO2 + C -> 2CO} $$
$$ \ce{CO2 + C -> 2CO} $$
